parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pro and horao; to behold in advance, i.e. to notice previously, or to keep in view.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Hades, the unseen world. Properly, unseen, i.e. 'Hades' or the place of departed souls.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Destruction, decay, corruption. From diaphtheiro; decay.
